item.title: Marine Electricals (India) Ltd Forms Death Cross, Signalling Bearish Trend Ahead
item.description: Marine Electricals (India) Ltd has recently formed a Death Cross, a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average crosses below the 200-day moving average. This development signals a potential shift towards a bearish trend, reflecting deteriorating momentum and raising concerns about the stock's medium to long-term prospects. Time: 12 minutes ago

item.title: Frontier Springs Ltd Forms Death Cross, Signalling Potential Bearish Trend
item.description: Frontier Springs Ltd, a notable player in the Auto Components & Equipments sector, has recently formed a Death Cross—a technical pattern where the 50-day moving average crosses below the 200-day moving average—indicating a potential shift towards a bearish trend and signalling long-term weakness in the stock’s price momentum. Time: 12 minutes ago

item.title: Cemindia Projects Ltd Forms Death Cross, Signalling Potential Bearish Trend

item.title: Gagan Gases Ltd Forms Death Cross, Signalling Potential Bearish Trend

This development is widely regarded as a bearish signal, indicating a potential deterioration in the stock’s medium to long-term trend and raising concerns about sustained weakness ahead. item.title: Dhampur Bio Organics Ltd Forms Golden Cross, Signalling Potential Bullish Breakout
item.description: Dhampur Bio Organics Ltd has recently witnessed a significant technical development as its 50-day moving average (DMA) crossed above the 200-day moving average, forming a classic Golden Cross pattern. This event is widely regarded by market analysts as a bullish signal, indicating a potential trend reversal and a shift towards long-term upward momentum for the stock within the sugar sector. Time: 13 minutes ago

item.title: Quarterly Earnings Review: Dec-2025 Results Show Mixed Trends Across Market Caps
item.description: The December 2025 quarter earnings season has revealed a nuanced picture across Indian equities, with 49.0% of the 983 stocks declaring results reporting positive outcomes. This marks a notable improvement from the preceding quarters, reflecting a gradual recovery in corporate profitability amid varied sectoral performances and market capitalisation segments. Time: 18 minutes ago

item.title: Sundaram Finance Q3 FY26: Robust Growth Momentum Continues with 19% Profit Surge
item.description: Sundaram Finance Ltd., a prominent non-banking financial company within the TVS Group, delivered a strong performance in Q3 FY26, with consolidated net profit surging 18.86% year-on-year to ₹541.36 crores. The Chennai-based NBFC, commanding a market capitalisation of ₹55,943 crores, saw its stock rally 7.35% on February 02, 2026, closing at ₹5,348.50 as investors responded positively to the quarter's robust operational metrics and sustained growth trajectory. Time: 32 minutes ago

item.title: Hyundai Motor India Q3 FY26: Margin Pressure Weighs Despite Revenue Growth
item.description: Hyundai Motor India Ltd., the country's second-largest passenger vehicle manufacturer, reported a mixed performance for Q3 FY26, with net profit declining 21.49% quarter-on-quarter to ₹1,234.40 crores despite revenue growth of 2.94% to ₹17,973.49 crores. The stock traded at ₹2,196.50 on February 02, 2026, representing a market capitalisation of ₹1,74,058 crores, as investors digested margin compression concerns that overshadowed the company's solid year-on-year revenue expansion of 7.96%. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Campus Activewear Q3 FY26: Strong Quarter Masks Deeper Structural Concerns
item.description: Campus Activewear Ltd., the domestic footwear manufacturer with a market capitalisation of ₹7,915.00 crores, delivered its strongest quarterly performance on record in Q3 FY26, with net profit surging to ₹63.68 crores. However, the impressive headline numbers conceal troubling structural issues that continue to plague the small-cap company, raising serious questions about its long-term growth trajectory and premium valuation. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Silver Touch Technologies Q3 FY26: Stellar Profit Surge Masks Valuation Concerns
item.description: Silver Touch Technologies Ltd., an Ahmedabad-based IT services and consulting company, reported a remarkable 109.32% year-on-year surge in consolidated net profit to ₹11.01 crores for Q3 FY26, significantly outpacing its 29.52% revenue growth to ₹96.34 crores. The micro-cap company, valued at ₹1,804 crores, delivered its strongest quarterly performance to date, with operating margins expanding to 19.94% from 13.29% a year ago. However, the stock retreated 1.94% on February 02, 2026, to close at ₹1,426.60, as investors grappled with stretched valuations at 71x trailing twelve-month earnings. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Jet Freight Logistics Q2 FY26: Profit Slumps 51% Despite Revenue Resilience
item.description: Jet Freight Logistics Ltd., a Mumbai-based freight forwarding and logistics solutions provider, reported a sharp 51.12% sequential decline in net profit for Q2 FY26, falling to ₹0.87 crores from ₹1.78 crores in Q1 FY26. Despite maintaining year-on-year profitability growth of 47.46%, the quarter exposed underlying margin pressures that weighed heavily on bottom-line performance. The stock, trading at ₹17.55 with a modest market capitalisation of ₹78 crores, has delivered a robust 22.56% return over the past year, significantly outperforming its transport services sector peers. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: WPIL Ltd Q3 FY26: Strong Quarter Masked by Technical Weakness and Valuation Concerns
item.description: WPIL Ltd., formerly known as Worthington Pump India Ltd., delivered a robust third quarter for FY26, with consolidated net profit surging 73.36% year-on-year to ₹54.33 crores, despite the stock languishing in a bearish technical trend. The Kolkata-based industrial manufacturing company, with a market capitalisation of ₹3,580 crores, posted net sales of ₹538.72 crores in Q3 FY26, marking a strong 41.17% YoY growth, though investors remain cautious given the stock's 38.76% decline over the past year. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Indian Toners & Developers Q3 FY26: Margin Pressures Amid Revenue Growth
item.description: Indian Toners & Developers Ltd., India's largest manufacturer and exporter of compatible toners for laser printers and digital machines, has delivered mixed results for Q3 FY26 (October-December 2025), with the stock trading at ₹243.45 as of February 02, 2026, reflecting a market capitalisation of ₹248.00 crores. The company reported net sales of ₹42.11 crores for the quarter, marking the highest quarterly revenue on record, yet profitability metrics have raised concerns amongst investors as margins contracted sequentially despite robust top-line growth. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Mahindra Lifespace Q3 FY26: Strong Revenue Surge Masks Underlying Profitability Concerns
item.description: Mahindra Lifespace Developers Ltd., the real estate development arm of the Mahindra Group, reported a dramatic revenue surge in Q3 FY26, with net sales skyrocketing to ₹459.16 crores—a staggering 2,514.81% quarter-on-quarter increase and 174.49% year-on-year growth. However, the impressive top-line expansion failed to translate into sustainable bottom-line improvement, with consolidated net profit reaching ₹108.88 crores, reflecting volatile profitability patterns that continue to plague the small-cap realty developer. The stock responded positively to the results, surging 4.69% on February 02, 2026, to close at ₹383.15, though it remains 10.55% below its 52-week high of ₹428.35. Time: 1 hour ago
